### Samples heatmap

```{r heatmap, echo=FALSE, fig.width=10, fig.height=6}
# TODO needs update for multiple contrasts
select <- order(rowVars(counts(dds, normalized = TRUE)), decreasing = TRUE)
if (heatmap_mode == "mean") {
  select <- order(rowMeans(counts(dds, normalized = TRUE)), decreasing = TRUE)
}

if (heatmap_mode == "diff") {
  select <- order(rowDiffs(counts(dds, normalized = TRUE)), decreasing = TRUE)
}

# filter top_n genes
select <- select[1:heatmap_n_genes]

# replace original gene ids with gene symbols to make it more readable
exp_mat <- assay(rld)[select, ] %>%
  as_tibble(rownames = type_in) %>%
  left_join(
    translate_gene_ids(
      .[[type_in]],
      sp_info = get_species_info(species),
      from_type = type_in,
      to_type = "SYMBOL",
      drop = FALSE
    )
  ) %>%
  dplyr::select(-matches(type_in)) %>%
  dplyr::distinct(SYMBOL, .keep_all = T) %>%
  column_to_rownames(var = "SYMBOL") %>%
  as.matrix()

annot_df <- colData(dds) %>%
  as.data.frame() %>%
  dplyr::select(matches(annotation_heatmap))

if (heatmap_n_genes < 50) {
  show_rownames <- TRUE
} else {
  show_rownames <- FALSE
}

heatmaply(exp_mat,
  colors = "RdYlBu",
  scale = "row",
  xlab = "Samples",
  ylab = "Genes",
  k_row = NA,
  k_col = NA,
  seriate = "mean",
  plot_method = "plotly",
  col_side_colors = annot_df,
  showticklabels = c(TRUE, show_rownames)
)
```
